what: Detection and Visualization of Sleep Cycles from Hypnogram Data
title: Detection and Visualization of Sleep Cycles from Hypnogram Data
text: sleepcycles package provides tools detecting, analyzing, visualizing sleep cycles hypnogram data using density-based rule-based (Feinberg) algorithms. supports single- multi-subject hypnograms, enabling users extract explore Non-REM (NREMP) REM (REMP) periods flexible parameter settings. package includes interactive Shiny application, suite visualization functions utilities validating sleep staging data. üìå Designed sleep researchers, clinicians, data scientists, sleepcycles helps uncover underlying dynamics sleep architecture assess impact sleep patterns healthy clinical populations.

title: Detection and Visualization of Sleep Cycles from Hypnogram Data
text: can install development version GitHub using remotes:
code: # Install remotes if not installed install.packages("remotes")  # Install sleepcycles from GitHub remotes::install_github("jasondude16/sleepcycles")

title: Detection and Visualization of Sleep Cycles from Hypnogram Data
code: library(sleepcycles)

title: Detection and Visualization of Sleep Cycles from Hypnogram Data
text: sleepcycles contains two example datasets: hypnogram_single hypnogram_grouped, contain single- multi-subject hypnograms, respectively. load multi-subject hypnogram example. sleepcycles requires hypnogram (format data frame) two variables: one epoch, one sleep stage; multiple subjects, ID variable also required.
code: data("hypnogram_grouped", package = "sleepcycles") head(hypnogram_grouped) #>   epoch stage id #> 1     1     W  1 #> 2     2     W  1 #> 3     3     W  1 #> 4     4     W  1 #> 5     5     W  1 #> 6     6     W  1

title: Detection and Visualization of Sleep Cycles from Hypnogram Data
code: sleepcycle_obj <- sleepcycles_from_hypnogram(   hypnogram_grouped,    epoch_col = "epoch",    stage_col = "stage",    id_col = "id",   verbose = FALSE )

title: Detection and Visualization of Sleep Cycles from Hypnogram Data
code: plot_cycles(sleepcycle_obj, id = "1") plot_hypnogram(sleepcycle_obj, id = "1")

title: Detection and Visualization of Sleep Cycles from Hypnogram Data
code: if (interactive()) {   run_sleepcycles_app(sleepcycle_obj) }

title: Detection and Visualization of Sleep Cycles from Hypnogram Data
text: ‚úî Sleep Cycle Detection: Supports Feinberg (Rule-Based) algorithm novel density-based algorithm ‚úî Interactive Visualization: Generate hypnograms, density plots, cycle summaries ‚úî Shiny App: Modify explore cycle detection parameters interactively ‚úî Preprocessing & Validation: Built-data validation tools ‚úî Single Grouped Data Support: Works individual multi-subject hypnogram datasets

what: Validate a Hypnogram Data Frame ‚Äî check_hypnogram
title: Validate a Hypnogram Data Frame ‚Äî check_hypnogram
text: function checks structure validity hypnogram dataset. ensures: presence required columns (epoch_col, stage_col). correct format epoch_col (numeric, ordered, contiguous). correct format stage_col (valid sleep stages, missing values). id_col provided, validation performed separately subject.

title: Validate a Hypnogram Data Frame ‚Äî check_hypnogram
code: check_hypnogram(   df,   epoch_col,   stage_col,   id_col = NULL,   valid_levels = c("N3", "N2", "N1", "R", "W", "A"),   on_error = "stop" )

title: Validate a Hypnogram Data Frame ‚Äî check_hypnogram
text: df data frame containing hypnogram. epoch_col column name represents sleep epochs (must numeric sequential). stage_col column name representing sleep stages. id_col (Optional) column representing subject IDs grouped data. provided, validation runs separately subject. valid_levels valid stage levels like check validating hypnogram. on_error Defines error handling behavior: "stop" (default) halt execution errors. "message" print warnings instead stopping execution. behavior allows user see errors ids working grouped hypnogram.

title: Validate a Hypnogram Data Frame ‚Äî check_hypnogram
text: Returns NULL validation successful. Otherwise, stops prints error message.

code: # Load the single-subject dataset data(hypnogram_single) head(hypnogram_single) #>   epoch stage #> 1     1     W #> 2     2     W #> 3     3     W #> 4     4     W #> 5     5     W #> 6     6     W  # Load the multi-subject dataset data(hypnogram_grouped) head(hypnogram_grouped) #>   epoch stage id #> 1     1     W  1 #> 2     2     W  1 #> 3     3     W  1 #> 4     4     W  1 #> 5     5     W  1 #> 6     6     W  1

what: Interactive Shiny App for Exploring Sleep Cycles ‚Äî run_sleepcycles_app
title: Interactive Shiny App for Exploring Sleep Cycles ‚Äî run_sleepcycles_app
text: function launches Shiny app allows users interactively explore modify sleep cycle detection parameters using Dude algorithm. app visualizes Non-REM Periods (NREMP) REM Periods (REMP) allowing users adjust key parameters control sleep cycles detected.

title: Interactive Shiny App for Exploring Sleep Cycles ‚Äî run_sleepcycles_app
code: run_sleepcycles_app(sleepcycles_obj)

title: Interactive Shiny App for Exploring Sleep Cycles ‚Äî run_sleepcycles_app
text: sleepcycles_obj SleepCycle object created using sleepcycles_from_hypnogram() method = "dude".

title: Interactive Shiny App for Exploring Sleep Cycles ‚Äî run_sleepcycles_app
text: Shiny app runs interactively adjusting Dude algorithm parameters.

title: Interactive Shiny App for Exploring Sleep Cycles ‚Äî run_sleepcycles_app
text: Dude algorithm identifies sleep cycles based density thresholds temporal continuity rules. app allows users adjust following NREMP REMP parameters: Density variable: EEG feature sleep stage combination used measure Non-REM density. Density threshold: cutoff value (0.1 - 1.0) defines constitutes Non-REM Period. Increasing value increase specificity may lower sensitivity. Minimum gap: minimum duration (epochs) two separate NREMP/REMPs. two NREMPs closer , merged one. Minimum size: shortest duration allowed (epochs) count NREMP/REMP.

title: Interactive Shiny App for Exploring Sleep Cycles ‚Äî run_sleepcycles_app
text: input must SleepCycle object created using Dude algorithm.

title: Interactive Shiny App for Exploring Sleep Cycles ‚Äî run_sleepcycles_app
code: if (interactive()) {   data("hypnogram_grouped")   run_sleepcycles_app(    sleepcycles_from_hypnogram(      hypnogram_grouped,      epoch_col = "epoch",      stage_col = "stage",      id_col = "id",      verbose = FALSE    )  ) }

code: plot_hypnogram(   sleepcycle_obj,   id = NULL,   stage_order = NULL,   overlay_cycles = TRUE,   overlay_clrs = c("#3B528BFF", "#5DC863FF") )  plot_densities(   sleepcycle_obj,   id = NULL,   clrs = c("#3B528BFF", "#5DC863FF"),   overlay_cycles = TRUE )  plot_cycles(sleepcycle_obj, id = NULL)

TRUE, overlays sleep cycles plots. overlay_clrs Color palette cycle overlays. clrs Color palette different sleep states.

text: ggplot object.

text: plot_hypnogram(): Plot standard hypnogram. plot_densities(): Plots density estimates sleep stages. plot_cycles(): Plots NREM REM cycles, well non-cycle segments (labeled NC plot).

code: data("hypnogram_single") plot_hypnogram(   sleepcycles_from_hypnogram(     hypnogram_single,     epoch_col = "epoch",     stage_col = "stage",     verbose = FALSE   ) )  plot_densities(   sleepcycles_from_hypnogram(     hypnogram_single,     epoch_col = "epoch",     stage_col = "stage",     verbose = FALSE,     method = "dude"   ) )  plot_cycles(   sleepcycles_from_hypnogram(     hypnogram_single,     epoch_col = "epoch",     stage_col = "stage",     verbose = FALSE   ) )

what: Extract Sleep Cycles from a Hypnogram ‚Äî sleepcycles_from_hypnogram
title: Extract Sleep Cycles from a Hypnogram ‚Äî sleepcycles_from_hypnogram
text: function detects sleep cycles hypnogram using one two algorithms: DUDE (Density-Based Underlying Dynamics Epochs): Uses sleep stage densities define sleep cycles. Feinberg (Classic Feinberg & Floyd method): Uses rule-based classification defining cycles.

title: Extract Sleep Cycles from a Hypnogram ‚Äî sleepcycles_from_hypnogram
code: sleepcycles_from_hypnogram(   df,   epoch_col,   stage_col,   method = "dude",   options = list(),   id_col = NULL,   verbose = TRUE )

title: Extract Sleep Cycles from a Hypnogram ‚Äî sleepcycles_from_hypnogram
text: df data frame containing sleep staging data. epoch_col string specifying column name sleep epochs (must numeric sequential). stage_col string specifying column name representing sleep stages. method algorithm used detecting sleep cycles. Options: "dude" (default) - Uses density-based clustering defining cycles. "feinberg" - Uses traditional rule-based heuristics cycle segmentation. options named list containing algorithm-specific parameters. left empty, default parameters used. DUDE Algorithm Options: "sleep_levels": Vector valid sleep stages (default: c("N1", "N2", "N3", "R")). "combos": Defines merged stages (e.g., list("N1_N2_N3" = c("N1", "N2", "N3"))). "NREMP": Named list defining NREM Period (NREMP) detection parameters: "density_col": Column used NREMP detection (default: "N1_N2_N3"). "threshold": Threshold cycle classification (default: 0.8). "min_gap": Minimum gap cycles (default: 20 epochs). "min_size": Minimum cycle duration (default: 40 epochs). "REMP": Named list defining REM Period (REMP) detection parameters: "density_col": Column used REMP detection (default: "R"). "threshold": Threshold cycle classification (default: 0.3). "min_gap": Minimum gap cycles (default: 15 epochs). "min_size": Minimum cycle duration (default: 10 epochs). "kernel": Gaussian kernel used smoothing sleep stage transitions. Feinberg Algorithm Options: "sleepstart": Defines sleep begins ("N1" "N2", default: "N1"). "treat_as_W": Defines stage treated wakefulness (default: ""). "rm_incomplete_period": Whether remove incomplete cycles (default: FALSE). "REMP_length": Minimum REM duration considered valid cycle (default: 10 epochs). "sleep_levels": Vector sleep stages included cycles (default: c("N1", "N2", "N3", "R")). id_col (Optional) string specifying column name subject IDs. provided, function processes subject separately. verbose Logical. TRUE (default), function prints warnings messages issues occur grouped data.

title: Extract Sleep Cycles from a Hypnogram ‚Äî sleepcycles_from_hypnogram
text: object class "SleepCycle", list containing: epoch: data frame per-epoch cycle classifications. summary: summary detected cycles start end epochs. info: list metadata including method used, selected options, sleep stage levels.

title: Extract Sleep Cycles from a Hypnogram ‚Äî sleepcycles_from_hypnogram
text: processes single-subject multi-subject data. grouped data (multiple IDs), applies selected method separately subject. function first validates input hypnogram using check_hypnogram(), ensuring correct format missing values. , based chosen method, calls either .sleepcycles_from_hypnogram_dude() .sleepcycles_from_hypnogram_feinberg() process data. id_col provided, function runs cycle detection independently subject combines results.

title: Extract Sleep Cycles from a Hypnogram ‚Äî sleepcycles_from_hypnogram
text: Feinberg, ., & Floyd, T. C. (1979). Systematic trends across night human sleep cycles. Psychophysiology, 16(3), 283-291.
